thread.title: Lauryn Hill postpones tonight's concert; cites 'scheduling conflict'
thread.title_full: Lauryn Hill postpones tonight's concert; cites 'scheduling conflict'

author: Scott Mervis / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Lauryn Hill postpones tonight's concert; cites 'scheduling conflict'
text:
Lauryn Hill postpones tonight's concert; cites 'scheduling conflict' February 27, 2017 9:35 AM Associated Press Lauryn Hill performs at Amnesty International’s “Bringing Human Rights Home” concert in New York in February 2014. Lauryn Hill By Scott Mervis / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
Lauryn Hill is having a rough time getting it right in Pittsburgh. 
Tonight's concert at the Byham, a make-up date for appearing late for a show last month at Heinz Hall, has been postponed. 
The Pittsburgh Cultural Trust posted on its site: “Due to a scheduling conflict, Ms. Lauryn Hill's performance at the Byham Theater has been moved to Friday, June 2. All tickets purchased for the February 27 show will be valid for the new date.” 
In May, Hill made her first Pittsburgh appearance in almost 20 years with a performance at the Carnegie of Homestead Music Hall. On a return trip Jan. 31 at Heinz Hall, the singer, known for her late arrivals, tested the patience of fans by not taking the stage until 11:20 p.m., about an hour after many people left, requesting a ticket refund. 
Hill apologized, explaining on social media that her band was delayed by bad weather, and scheduled Monday’s concert as a make-up, offering ticketholders from January tickets for half price. 
How there could have been a scheduling conflict has not been explained. 
Scott Mervis: smervis@post-gazette.com.
